newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Victoria to receive A$84mln cash from Edison sale.
newsitem.headline: Victoria to receive A$84mln cash from Edison sale.

text.p: The Australian state of Victoria said on Tuesday it would receive A$84 million cash from the sale of 49 percent of the 1,000-megawatt Loy Yang B power station to Edison Mission Energy, a unit of Edison International.
Edison Mission Energy acquired 51 percent of Loy Yang B in December 1992.

As part of the sale, Edison also will terminate the 30-year 'take or pay' power supply contracts the state entered into during a debt crisis in the early 1990's as well as hedging an expected A$2 billion of losses from aluminium smelter contracts.
"These changes will save taxpayers in total in excess of A$2 billion and reduce the state's risks," Victorian treasurer Alan Stockdale said in a statement.
In the early 1990's the state's debt crisis caused a shortfall in meeting construction costs for the power station.

"As a result the former SECV (State Electricity Corp of Victoria) negotiated a 'take or pay' electricity supply contract that locked Victorians into paying for massively overpriced electricity based on erroneous judgements of future electricity demands," Stockdale said.
